title: Tracey Cox - How to be a superflirt
description:
Are they flirting or just being friendly?

Have you been paying attention? If you have, hopefully youÃƒÂ¢??ll spot the clues of whoÃƒÂ¢??s genuinely interested in who, and on what level. Be warned though: initial impressions can be deceptive and all is not as it first appears when first looking at this picture. Start by studying the group of three people on the left. A quick glance and it seems the girl is interested in the guy in the black top standing next to her. After all, sheÃƒÂ¢??s smiling, facing toward him and heÃƒÂ¢??s leaning forward to invade her personal space. All are signs of sexual interest. Look a little closer, however, and youÃƒÂ¢??ll see telltale signs that the real flirting is happening between her and the tall guy in the blue shirt.

Although sheÃƒÂ¢??s smiling at the guy next to her, itÃƒÂ¢??s an insincere smile. A real smile fades and broadens in response to whatÃƒÂ¢??s happening, a fake one stays fixed and itÃƒÂ¢??s clear her jaw is straining to hold this ÃƒÂ¢??politeÃƒÂ¢?? smile in position. She might be leaning forward, but itÃƒÂ¢??s toward the bar, not the guy and other signals suggest sheÃƒÂ¢??s not at all happy about being ÃƒÂ¢??invadedÃƒÂ¢?? space wise. And what about the pretty girls at the end of the bar? What does their posture say? Lots actually.
